quiz.question: In which country is chewing gum sales restricted to prevent litter and clean public transport?
Which nation's local law once required barbers to pay a licensing fee and prohibited certain haircuts in historic codes?
Which country has a law that requires citizens to clear snow from the sidewalk in front of their property within certain hours?
Which European country once banned wearing camouflage clothing to avoid military impersonation concerns?
Which country forbids the public display of other countries' flags in some tense diplomatic contexts historically?
Which country has a law requiring pubs to serve non-alcoholic options prominently to reduce drink-driving risks?
Which country has regulations limiting how loudly you can close car doors at night in residential areas?
Which country prohibits selling alcohol in some regions on certain religious or cultural holidays?
Which U.S. city enforced a law forbidding the use of public mime performances due to a 19th-century vagrancy statute?
Which country prohibits the use of loudspeakers for political advertising late at night in many areas?
Which country had a law banning children from riding scooters on sidewalks in some cities for safety?
Which European country outlaws using drones to record private property without consent under strict privacy legislation?
In which country is it illegal to flush the toilet after 10 p.m. in some apartment house rules to preserve water and quiet?
Which country made it illegal to show certain political films during elections historically to prevent influence?
Which U.S. city had a 19th-century ordinance banning rum-running by tying liquor to horses, an example of creative enforcement?
